data.text:
This hotel is ok, but very old. We visited during the heath wave and the air conditioning did not work properly. We asked the staff several times to have a look at it, but this did not improve the situation. 
The staff was very friendly and helpful, and it’s not their fault that the weather was extremely hot. 
The breakfast was ok. The restaurants and the hotel were also just ok. 
The location is a bit far from any city centre. This is a ok hotel if you want to save money.
data.title: Extremely warm, but friendly staff.

data.text:
I stayed here in July with my young family, sister, her partner and daughter. The hotel in general surpassed my expectations. The rooms was lovely and clean, our cleaner who I can’t remember her name was so sweet with my two daughters and it was spotless everyday, we upgraded to a larger room and it was so spacious, the room was quiet even though overlooking the pool with beds that was both large and comfy especially when you often get children who need cuddles in the night all four of us could fit comfortably in one bed.
The pool isn’t too deep so perfect for children to play in, I thought i would never get them out, and the shaded pool was perfect in the heat in Rhodes in July, the pool meanders round it is lovely. 
The staff at this hotel are some of the best I’ve ever experienced so friendly from the cleaners to management and always happy to help.
The hotel is dated but I think it adds to the charm but it is clean, well maintained, and authentic, my only downside was the salt water pool which could sting the eyes but once the girls got there goggles it didn’t bother them anymore.
Food and drinks was fabulous in the pool bar and the restaurants, the souvlaki stand is great for afternoon snacks! (note to add here is that the hotel prices for food and drink is not anymore expensive than the bars and restaurants outside the hotel) also it is only a short walk to the bars and restaurants of Ixia. Rhodes town is a must to visit in the day and also at night and only a short taxi ride, we also did a boat trip to Lindos which was great value and a lovely day to explore the meandering streets of this little medieval town and the acropolis.
Unfortunately we was here when the wildfires broke, however nowhere near this area the staff kept us well informed and seemed concerned for ours and others safety advising us where and where not to go, all of Rhodes stood together and there was an immense sense of togetherness at this time and they looked after all the tourists who was affected. this did effect where we could visit but didn’t affect our experience, it only made me love Rhodes and it’s people more.
Overall a great holiday i would recommend it to friends and family, great value authentic hotel, a great place to explore this beautiful island with great Grecian hospitality,
data.title: Little gem

data.text:
We stayed 6 nights B+B in September booked through ‘On the beach’ which was well organised. 
Its a nice hotel, built in the 70’s so I see why people view it as dated but it’s kept in good condition. 
We do B+B so we can try different local restaurants but we did end up eating there twice as the Mexican restaurant is superb with great service, also the wraps served by the pool are legendary! . 
The beach is pebbles so take beach shoes, although by waist deep it’s nice sand. 
We walked up to the lovely old town which takes 45-60 mins up the litter strewn beach front walkway, the buses are hit and miss but a taxi is 10 euro ish. 
We hired a car and moped from down the road for 40 euro and took a trip out. 
The Island is run down out of the main resort areas.
data.title: Nice hotel, relaxing holiday.

user_location.name: Chirk, Wrexham County, North Wales, Wales

data.text: Great Hotel. Food is excellent in all of the restaurants. Place is spotless & all of the staff are amazing. Particular shout out to Dona, the guest relation manager. Thanks for all of your help Dona. I will definitely be back next year. Will go down as one of my go to hotels.
data.title: Great experience

owner_response.title: Owner response
owner_response.text:
It was a pleasure to host you into our little paradise!

Your comments and insights sound very inspiring, which is wonderful for us since they are coming from well-traveled guests as you are!
The open amazement of your sea view room, its spectacular views, our Spa's Traditional Turkish Bath, our cuisine, and, of course, the amazing women and men who wear the Dionysos uniform proudly, all bring your future expectations to a new level. And whether it's "lazy mornings" in your spacious accommodations or dining at our one of our thematic restaurants, this vacation is yours to enjoy the way you want, and when you want. 
And we'll be awaiting your next arrival to continue this wonderful journey right where you left off.

On behalf of the professionals at Dionysos, I thank you for trusting us to make these moments "worth every penny!!"

Take care, and all the best for a happy 2024.

Our Kindest Regards, 
Dona Giourga 
Guest Relations 
Dionysos Hotel
owner_response.author: Dona Giourga

data.text:
I stayed here with my girlfriend and her daughter with the sister and her family staying too.
The children would have happily stayed at the hotel, playing in the pool every day if it wasn't for the adults wanting to explore the island a bit more. The nearby beach was a short walk away and also a hit with the children and Rhodes town is less than 10 minutes by taxi.
Panagiotis who worked at the swim up bar was great, as was Anna working in the Ice Cream bar, often seen walking around and tidying up after some of the guests.
Unfortunately, my girlfriend's daughter got food poising (from elsewhere) towards the end of the holiday and was very sick. The reception and cleaning staff were absolute superstars! Irini on reception in particular was very caring and helped us arrange for a doctor to come and visit us at the hotel instead of us having to travel.
Fortunately it was only for one day and she was back to her old self, playing in the pool and having a great time.
We only ate once at the hotel, in the Mexican restaurant and the food and service was excellent. The bar staff were also great when we had drinks before going out each night. Breakfast had lots of options which was great for picky young eaters and hungry adults alike.
Would definitely recommend this hotel for family stays and just want to thank the staff again for looking after us when it was needed.
data.title: Lovely hotel with friendly, attentive staff.

owner_response.title: Owner response
owner_response.text:
Thank you,  for taking a moment to express your great satisfaction on this, your very recent visit to Dionysos Hotel.

As you now know firsthand, once you reserve with us, we start to shape your vacation itinerary with your pre-arrival concierge, who offers to begin arranging your transportation and reservations. 
Then, once you arrive at our majestic lobby, you are greeted by our amazing guest relations who briefly orientates you on Dionysos and who will be there to assist you and keep you informed during the duration of your stay. 

And once you're on your way to your suite, you comfortably realize that you and your loved ones are in very capable hands.

We hope that the wonderful memories of this trip entice you to return sooner than expected.

As always, we remain at your faithful service, 

Our Kindest Regards, 
Dona Giourga 
Guest Relations 
Dionysos Team
owner_response.author: Dona Giourga
